meanings.definition: The quality or state of being impalpable.
meanings.sent1: The impalpabilities of the ghost made it impossible to touch.
meanings.sent2: The impalpabilities of air make it difficult to grasp.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved the impalpabilities of disappearing coins.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were like impalpabilities, fleeting and intangible.
meanings.sent5: The impalpabilities of dreams often slip away upon waking.

meanings.sent1: The room was filled with impalpabilities, like emotions and memories.
meanings.sent2: The impalpabilities of the spiritual world are beyond our physical senses.
meanings.sent3: The artist tried to capture the impalpabilities of love in his painting.
meanings.sent4: The impalpabilities of time seem to slip through our fingers.
meanings.sent5: The impalpabilities of the universe are vast and mysterious.
